citation.article-title: Kistimonas asteriae gen. nov., sp. nov., a gammaproteobacterium isolated from Asterias amurensis
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Kistimonas asteriae sp. nov.
Kistimonas asteriae (as.te′ri.ae. N.L. gen. n. asteriae of Asterias amurensis, a starfish).
Cells are Gram-stain-negative, aerobic, motile and rod-shaped.
Light-yellow-pigmented colonies are formed on A1+C medium, nutrient agar, marine agar and TSA medium.
Grows between 15 and 30 °C, with an optimal temperature of 25 °C.
No growth observed in A1+C medium prepared with deionized water without NaCl.
No colonies detected when medium contains 11–15 % NaCl.
Growth is reduced by NaCl at concentrations higher than 9 % (w/v).
Grows at pH 5–10 but not at pH 4.

Can utilize the following carbon sources in the API 50CH test: glycerol, ribose, galactose, d-glucose, d-fructose, inositol, mannitol, methyl-α-d-glucopyranoside, amygdalin, arbutin, aesculin, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, lactose, melibiose, sucrose, trehalose, melezitose, raffinose, starch, glycogen, β-gentiobiose, turanose, d-tagatose, l-arabitol and potassium 5-ketogluconate.
Can also use gelatin and xylan as a carbon source, but not casein or alginate.
Shows β-galactosidase activity as determined by a nitrophenyl-β-d-galactopyranoside reaction in API 20E and API 20NE tests (Table 1).
Does not produce H2S, indole or acetoin.
Positive for the oxidation of glucose, mannitol, sucrose and melibiose, and the assimilation of glucose, mannitol, N-acetylglucosamine, maltose, gluconate and malate in API 20E and API 20NE tests.
API ZYM tests using naphthyl-substrates indicate positive results for the activities of alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4) and esterase lipase (C8).

However, test results are negative for lipase (C14), leucine arylamidase, valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, acid phosphatase, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase.
The type strain KMD 001T (KCCM 90076T =JCM 15607T) was isolated from the skin of Asterias amurensis collected at the Im-Won port in Samcheok, East Sea in Korea.
